Description: Ivory arrowhead: of square section with a round tang, broken at the end. The tip is stained with red ochre and there is a ring of similar red staining at the base of the point, just above the start of the tang.
Curator's comments: For similar objects, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.VIIA, 7; XXXII, 37: XXXVII, 15-17; XXXVIII. 5-7; XL, 12-13; XLI, 38-41; XLII, 67; XLIII, 5-8; xlw, 4-6; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tombs of the courtiers and Oxyrhynkos' (London, 1925), pl. II, 7; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan I and Memphis V' (London, 1913), pl.IX, 14-18; T. E. Peet in E. Naville (ed.), ‘The cemeteries of Abydos’ II (London, 1913), 33-4 and pl.X, 3; . J. E. Quibell, ‘Archaic Objects’ (Cairo, 1905), pl.XI, 6; W. B. Emery, ‘Excavations at Saqqara : the tomb of Hemaka' (Cairo, 1938), 46, type 5 and pl.21; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' I' (Cairo, 1949), 103, cat. no. 54; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II' (London, 1954), 63-4 and pl.XXVII, 69-71; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ I, (1895-6), pl.XLI; ibid., vol. III (1897-8), pl.III; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ I (Berlin, 1929-31), nos. 199-209 and pl.9; W. Wolf, 'Die bewaffnung des altägyptischen Heeres' (Leipzig, 1926) , 17-18 and pl.9, (9-13). Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 35, pl.XXXIV, 27-49 (examples).
